instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1398: What is A1398? A1398 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2015, Mid 2012, Early 2013, Late 2013, Mid 2014 with EMC 2909, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00138, 820-00163, 820-00426, 820-3332, 820-3662, 820-3787..
definitions.U8900: What is U8900? This chip creates the GPU power rails on the 820-3332 board to the 2012 and early 2013 15‚Äù Retina Macbook Pros. It becomes desoldered and is the cause of no video and kernel panics/crashes in that model most of the time..

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> A820-3332 <CHIP>U8900</CHIP> Pin Voltages
threads.message:
Hi:
Im reflowing the famed <CHIP>U8900</CHIP> in an <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2012 MBP Retina 15 for display issues and notice that the continuity on PIN 39 and 40 in system off state (power and battery disconnected) is short to ground.

Can someone please confirm if the PIN 39 with signal  <SIGNAL>GFXIMVP_DPSLP_EN</SIGNAL> and PIN 40 with signal <SIGNAL>CLK_EN</SIGNAL>* is supposed to be short to ground!

Regards,

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> A820-3332 <CHIP>U8900</CHIP> Pin Voltages
threads.message:
Do not reflow it!
Just resolder pins using leaded solder.
Allow 10-20s after remove power, before any diode mode reading.
You can now remove the chip and check corresponding signals on diode mode to ground.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> A820-3332 <CHIP>U8900</CHIP> Pin Voltages
threads.message:
Sorry, I meant resolder and not reflow. Nevertheless, both signals show short to ground though eDP retina panel works fine. 
just want to check if the signal levels in off state are correct.
